means: 书信的，书信体的，用书信的

sentence.Network_en: The Color Purple ( 1982 ) is an epistolary novel featuring on women characterization.
sentence.Network_cn: 《紫色》是一部以刻划女性形象为特色的书信体小说.

sentence.Network_en: The novel adopts an epistolary form and depicts vivid and larger - than - life characters.
sentence.Network_cn: 小说采用书信体刻画了栩栩如生、个性鲜明的人物形象.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 这样记单词真的很有效_英语吧_百度贴吧 ... ephemera 生命短促的人（或物）. epistolary 书信的. epicure 美食家. /人名/.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French épistolaire or Latin epistolaris, from epistola (see epistle)

entry.def: An epistolary novel or story is one that is written as a series of letters.

example.tran: 拉克洛的著名书信体小说

means.word_mean: 1. written in the form of or carried on by letters or correspondence;

sentences.sentence: "an endless sequence of epistolary love affairs"

auth_sentence.content: They were, however, strange epistolary bedfellows.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They were, however, strange epistolary bedfellows.

auth_sentence.content: Barry and Hatto had similar epistolary styles.
auth_sentence.res_content: Barry and Hatto had similar epistolary styles.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Barry and Hatto had similar epistolary styles.

auth_sentence.content: Some writers adapt themselves to their correspondents, even to the extent of changing their epistolary style.
